data.title: Not impressed
data.text: I have always been about supporting local business, especially restaurants. I had been excused for lunch from Jury Duty and I stopped in. Atmosphere is ok, a little dim. Waitress was pleasant and brought a menu  right away. I ordered the side salad and the Bourbon Poutine. Let me say, I am a poutine Nazi, as I am married to a French Canadian and we fix it all the time at home. My side salad came relatively quick, a little disappointing, no frills. Just lettuce with 2 tiny cherry tomatoes and  a side of ranch. Finished that  and had to wait quite a while for the rest of my meal. While the picture may make it look good - it wasn't.  First and foremost - NEVER serve food that is burned, which several of my fries obviously were. To a crisp. Black. Second, Poutine is supposed to be a ooyee gooee cheesy concoction with gravy and fries. I had literally 6 cheese curds on it, not melted but hard as a rock, burned too. It gets better! The "duck" on it was shredded.... horribly dried out and hard. Obviously this dish sat under a broiler, which is not how poutine is prepared. Another resturant down the street introduced poutine to Erie, I know this because my husband is the one who introduced that resturants owner to it. Obviously trying to copy a dish they do not know how to prepare. Sorry - very disappointed overall

data.title: Atmosphere, food presentation & taste spot on
data.text: We were in for dinner last week and had the Stockyard Strip which was a beautiful cut of meat and  done perfectly. Just loved the brussel sprouts & rice pilaf served with it. Added a generous side salad with white balsamic. Not to forget the risotto bites with side sauce for our app. We will be back to try the Montery pasta and add shrimp to it.

data.title: great lunch
data.text: Great food, very unique, good location often have bands playing next door on weekends. Fast lunch service

data.title: Unsatisfactory
data.text: This place is a feeble attempt to pass itself off as a so called gastropub; as far as my wife and I are concerned it's a deficient attempt. We've tried eating here three times to make sure that we are correct, and without a doubt, we will not be back. When they have steak, (we tried ordering them on a Monday and after a wait, we were told they had only one), the steaks are tough and gristly; the chicken and waffles, perhaps spoiled, over the top salty, and the surf and turf (stew meat again) and, quite frankly inedible. The poutine is a miserable, salty, hodge-podge of shaken but not stirred French fries and the afore-mentioned tough stew meat. We will not go back for a fourth try; we're not masochists. One thing outstanding was our waitress, Hannah T. Somehow, she made our experience painless.

data.title: A Restaurant in front of a Dance Club
data.text: Food is average to good and somewhat limited. Our service was adequate although our drinks were skimpy but our server took care of us. We'll likely return as the prices are reasonable and it's easily except with nearby parking. Atmosphere is ok with most seating located in the bar area at hightop tables.  Weekend nights are noisy as this restaurant is a Thruway to a dance club with very loud music and a younger crowd. Millennials will love this place.

data.title: Great with a Groupon!
data.text:
28 North is one of those places that you'd expect to find in a bigger city than Erie, but still has a nice hometown feel. Sitting in Perry Square, the 28 North entrance isn't much to look at (you could definitely miss it if you weren't looking for it). The outside seating is actually a shared entrance to Coconut Joe's, an outdoor tiki-style bar that sports live music. Inside the restaurant, there is a great gastro-pub setting that has a nice list of wine, craft brew, and cocktails. Outside of happy hour the drinks can be a little pricey (for Erie), but still better than what you would pay in the big city. 

Their food menu is not extremely extensive, but has nice variety and is fairly priced. It includes some pub-style food like craft burgers and pizza, but also has fancier dishes. Personal favorites include the Gouda Burger and fries and Margherita Pizza. 

There is usually a Groupon Local deal for a shared pizza (veggie or margherita) and a bottle of select wine for $19 that I highly suggest for a date night. The bottle and pizza I believe would go for $35 typically, and on a nice night sitting outside while the band plays at Coconut Joe's is a joy!

data.title: nice lunch
data.text: stopped in for lunch after walking around roar on the shore. Absolutely a excellent choice. The special was brisket and 3 of our party of 6 got it and it was excellent. The others got sandwiches and no one was disappointed. If your in town looking for some good food at very reasonable prices this is the place.

data.title: Friday night dinner
data.text: Menu has been significantly changed, went for mussels, which were delicious, but no longer served. Gastropub has good food, but loud with live music next door.

data.title: Perfect date night!
data.text: Looking to try something new, but wanting to stay in downtown Erie, we tried 28 North. Both of us were happy with the craft beer/drinks selection and our burgers were super awesome!!!! Sounds crazy but it's not always easy to find an honestly good hamburger. Everything about our burgers, down to the homemade pickles, was super yummy. The added $2 for fries instead of chips was worth it too! Will definitely return!

data.title: Neat place
data.text:
Hit or miss with waitstaff. 

Food is good. Try caprese pizza. 

Cuban is good as well. 
Drinks are good. Atmosphere is small, but nice.

data.title: Happy hour
data.text:
Happy hour draft prices were great, if I return, will be based solely on those. The food... I feel I am gracious in criticism, however... Low quality meat, greasy, under seasoned food for this price is unforgivable.
Waitress is also bartender. Would not penalize for this fact in tips, but surely a 'fine dining" faux paux. Unfortunately, our first visit will be our last. Despite word of mouth reviews for pizza and drinks, the apps and entrees were a sore disappointment. Need to step it up if wanting to compete with Bertrand's, cloud nine, and especially 1201 in downtown Erie.

data.title: Nice datenight meal on a Monday
data.text:
First off, this is the restaurant that is the bar in the old Boardwalk complex. The dark hardwood flooring is new, but other than that, it looks the same minus a few new wall decorations.  We came on a Monday night for happy hour and it was very quiet.  The bartender was also the server for the restaurant.  
    The happy hour wine menu was great - $5 for pretty much any wine on their list.  The pours were from a wine draft and were VERY generous.  They carry Apothic red (which goes with everything!).  
    We had several items off the menu, starting with the veggie flatbread.  The veggies were nice and crisp, but a bit too heavy for the slightly soft flatbread.  Eating required a hand underneath to make sure nothing fell off.  Next, we had bbq shrimp spread over a bed of risotto.  This was excellent.  The shrimp were plentiful and the risotto flavorful.  This could have been an entrée and we highly recommend it.
   Next up, we split an apple walnut salad.  We had the maple cider dressing on the side and requested a gorgonzola dressing on the side too.  We mixed a little of each together on the salad and a little went a long way.  We used maybe 15% of each dressing bowl on the salad.  The mix was fantastic and it cut the sweetness of the cider very well.  Portion size wasn't huge, but it was enough to split as a light appetizer.  Overall value wasn't great on this dish ($10), but tasty nonetheless.
    For dinner, I had the stockyard strip, ordered medium rare.  It came with a huge portion of grilled brussel sprouts and an equally big portion of sliced seasoned potatoes.  The steak was undercooked, mostly rare.  Very disappointing.  The potatoes were tasty and the sprouts were pretty good (I don't have much of a basis for comparison as I don't recall ever eating sprouts in my adult life).  Overall though, the steak had some hard fat lining the side that was inedible, coupled with it being undercooked, I would not order again.
   My wife's entrée, the surf and turf kabob was fantastic!  The portion size was very big and blended beef and shrimp on kabob skewers on a bed of what I think was risotto and rice.  She loved it.  I sampled it and it was excellent.  
    So, overall the bbq shrimp skewers and the surf and turf kabobs were the highlights of our date night.  
  As for service - our female server/bartender was very personable and attentive.  She also was not overbearing, giving us plenty of time to just sit and talk as we were there for several hours.
  We dined with the fine dining card and would recommend going to 28 North. The only thing I would steer clear of is the steak.

data.title: Unique new restuarant
data.text: Love this new restaurant in the heart of downtown Erie. It serves up unique & delicious choices for your palate such as Chicken Picatta, Pot Roast Poutine, Chicken & Waffles. It's no wonder it was chosen to be on the Fine Dining card this year.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: Went in with my wife and some friends on Saturday night for dinner and some drinks. I ordered the Poutine and my wife had the surf and turf kabobs.  Both were delicious. I ordered an Old Fashioned and my wife had the Berry White martini. I have to say it was the best Old Fashioned I have ever had!

data.title: Great Food, Great Atmosphere!
data.text: Great place to visit in Downtown Erie. Great selection of good dishes, and surprisingly affordable! We have enjoyed the beautiful views of the new park with both the indoor and outdoor seating. Highly recommended!

data.title: Great New Place
data.text: Just checked this place out for the 1st since it opened, as it's on the Erie Fine Dining program now, and it was excellent...  Great different martini's and the food was very good, and reasonably priced...  Can't wait to go back  ....   Very nice inside, and waitress was very nice...

data.title: Super cool place
data.text: This was our first trip to 28 North suggested by our friend and her husband on a warmer than usual November Friday evening. We sat in a high table in main dining/bar area. They also have a separate "club" with a stage and private party room. (More on that later). Our server was so friendly and attentive to our needs. I ordered the crispy fish tacos. Very yummy and also will say had a good bite with the spices added. I love it! Now back to the club....This spot takes into account a separate clientele that prefers to enjoy good music and dance with some legal adult beverages. The band sounded great and the way the space is separate with glass doors is efficient and takes into consideration the diners may want peace and quiet for their dining. Good job 28 North this town needs more local restaurants. Keep up the good work.

data.title: Quick meal
data.text: Koreena was my bartender and provided great suggestions.  The chicken Po Boy sandwich and the soup were excellent.  On a Tuesday, the place was not crowded at all.  The bar needs to be changed, as it is very hard to eat when sitting there, but the food was worth it.  Will def return next time.

data.title: Downtown Saturday NIght
data.text: We went here early on a rainy Saturday evening. The service was excellent, the food very good, and the drinks fun and delicious. I had the shrimp tacos, which were crunchy and tart with the asian slaw - so tasty! The pizzete crust was a big hit, although the thick bacon was a tad bit over-smoked for our taste. The chicken po-boy was huge and super crispy. We had an expertly made Manhattan as well as a "Great Gatsby". Both were good enough that we would go back for them alone!  Try this place out!

data.title: I thought I was in a big city!
data.text: My daughter and I stopped in for a bite just to try it out and we came away so impressed! this palce is the total package. Chic on the inside with a great menu, super food, a really good bar, and the prices are fantastic. I had the chicken tacos, my daughter had a shaved beef sandwich that came with an egg on top, home made fries, and some tremendous craft beer selections. By far the best craft beer prices in town. High end liquors without the high end price. Great place, will be back this week. BTW, are server was great!
